data.title: Economic
data.text:
The Republic of Moldova will receive from the European Commission a financial support of 72.5 million euros by the end of October

The European Commission will disburse financial support of 72.5 million euros to the Republic of Moldova, as part of the ongoing macro-financial assistance operation for the country. On Wednesday, October 25, the Republic of Moldova received a loan of 50 million euros, and by the end of the month a new tranche of 22.5 million euros will follow in the form of a grant, informs the Delegation of the European Union in the Republic of Moldova.

UTA Gagauzia will have to return taxes and VATs from its own budget

President Maia Sandu promulgated the draft law by which UTA Găgăuzia will have to return taxes and VATs from its own budget, and not from the national one. The decree promulgating the law was published today in the Official Gazette.

Japan will offer a grant worth 1.9 million euros for farmers in the Republic of Moldova

The Government of Japan will offer the Republic of Moldova non-refundable financial support in the amount of 1.9 million euros. The money will be directed to support small and medium-sized farmers, who are affected by the increase in the price of seed material, fertilizers and pesticides. In this regard, the members of the Foreign Policy and European Integration Commission approved the report for initiating negotiations and approving the signing of a Grant Agreement.

Several wine producers from the Republic of Moldova presented their products at an exhibition in South Korea

Five wine producers from the Republic of Moldova participated in "Vinexpo Meetings 2023", which took place last week in Seoul, South Korea. Thus, Moldovan producers had the opportunity to identify new importers and opportunities for business development, informs the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Industry in a press release.

Norway will offer a grant of over 34 million euros to the Republic of Moldova

The Government of Norway is willing to grant the Republic of Moldova a grant worth 34 million euros, through the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), to strengthen the energy security of the country.
